pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:0.4: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:0.5: 11. The training rule on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.2: a male relative of a nun who was a pupil of Bhaddā Kāpilānī went from his own village to Sāvatthī on some business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.3: Then, in the dark of the night and without a lamp, that nun stood and talked alone with that man.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.4: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.5: “How could a nun do such a thing?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.6: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.9: “How could a nun do such a thing?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.11: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:1.12.1: ‘If, in the dark of the night without a lamp, a nun stands or talks alone with a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.5: In the dark of the night:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.10: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.14: just the man and the nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.16: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.18: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.19: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1.20: If she stands or talks with a male spirit, a male ghost, a _paṇḍaka_, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.2: if she has a companion who understands;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.3: if she is not seeking privacy;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.4: if she stands or talks thinking of something else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.2.7: The first training rule is finished.
